intro: Streptanthus lilacinus, commonly known as the lilac flowering rocket, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal or mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually pink to lilac in color, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Streptanthus lilacinus is often found in open habitats and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
